description: Winter is the defining season for many organisms in Minnesota, leading to specialized adaptations to survive winter's challenges. This course will focus on those adaptations that allow plants and animals to thrive in our climate. Coursework will include selected readings from the primary literature, field research, and opportunities to learn about the natural history of local plants and animals in the field. Prerequisites: BIO 150 and BIO 261, preferred. If you have not had BIO 261, please consult with the department chair (kandl@stolaf.edu) or the instructor (putnam3@stolaf.edu).
name: Top: Ecology of Winter Landscape
notes: First-year students by permission of instructor only.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: BIO 150 and BIO 261, preferred. If you have not had BIO 261, please consult with the department chair (kandl@stolaf.edu) or the instructor (putnam3@stolaf.edu).

revisions.description: Students study topics in biology. Topics vary from year to year at the discretion of the department. Class work depends on the topics and instructor, but is consistent with the amount and level of work in other 200-level biology courses. May be repeated if topics are different. Prerequisites vary. Counts as an elective toward biology major. May count toward other majors or concentrations if approved by the chair of that major/concentration. Offered periodically.
revisions.prerequisites: Prerequisites vary. Counts as an elective toward biology major. May count toward other majors or concentrations if approved by the chair of that major/concentration. Offered periodically.

title: Topics in Biology
